result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:46 AM Defendant Devin R Ozowski in court.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Devin R Ozowski.  Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is requesting new counsel. Attorney Gardner is requesting to be removed as counsel. Court grants the withdrawal. This matter will be reset. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devin R Ozowski in court. 
Defendant asks Court to appoint counsel. Court finds defendant is not indigent.
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:23 AM Defendant Devin R Ozowski in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court questions the defendant regarding obtaining an attorney.  Officer Chris Zawislan is sworn as witness and testifies to the facts.  Testifies to the report of a erratic driver and finding the vehicle.  Witness identifies the defendant in court, Court accepts.  Testifies to speaking with the defendant while in the vehicle and what he seen in the vehicle while talking to the defendant. Testifies to having the defendant step out of the vehicle to do field sobriety tests.  Testifies to patting down the defendant and why.  Testifies to what he found from that pat down.  Testifies to substances found, tests done and results of tests.  Testifies regarding what was found in the vehicle and results of those tests.  Probable cause found. Bond continued
Arraignment scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
